Situation1: They join in when the family talks about possible weekend plans.
Situation2: This is the last weekend before the partner relocates abroad for months.
Story: I sat at the dinner table, swirling my fork in mashed potatoes, half-listening as my stepdad suggested a family hiking trip for the weekend. My mom’s eyes sparkled, and my stepbrother grinned, already talking about which trail to take. I knew they wanted me there, to bond, to show I was really part of this new family. But my phone buzzed in my pocket—another message from Jamie, my boyfriend. He was leaving for Germany on Monday, and this weekend was our last chance to be together before months apart. He wanted to spend every moment with me, just us, making memories to hold onto. My heart twisted as I tried to smile at my family, feeling their hope that I’d say yes. But Jamie’s words echoed in my mind, and I felt torn in two, caught between being the daughter and sister they wanted, and the girlfriend Jamie needed. I stared at my plate, wishing I could be in two places at once, dreading the choice I’d have to make.
